data.title: "Prince Frederic Guillaume Louis de Prusse, Second Son of the King" Breguet, No. 2846, sold to The Prince Frederic-Guillaume-Louis de Prusse, second son of the King, on May 3, 1814, for 1,248 francs.
data.meta_description: Antiquorum is the world's premiere auction house of modern and vintage timepieces. Buy or sell watches like Patek Philippe, Rolex and Audemars Piguet. Expert appraisals, valuations and more. Browse our auction catalog.
data.text:
Important Collectors Wristwatches, P...

Geneva, Mandarin Oriental Hotel Du Rhône, Oct 15, 2006

LOT 20

"Prince Frederic Guillaume Louis de Prusse, Second Son of the King" Breguet, No. 2846, sold to The Prince Frederic-Guillaume-Louis de Prusse, second son of the King, on May 3, 1814, for 1,248 francs. Very fine and rare, 18K gold pocket watch with quarter repeating. Accompanied by Breguet certificate No. 3998, box and key.

C. Three body, "forme quatre baguettes", by Amy Gros (master mark), with reeded band and polished back. Hinged gold cuvette. D. White enamel with Breguet numerals and outer minute divisions. Blued steel "Breguet" hands. M. 44 mm. (20???), free-standing barrel, jeweled overhanging ruby cylinder escapement, with parachute suspension, plain three-arm gold balance, blued steel flat balance spring with index regulator, repeating with two hammers on two gongs activated by depressing the pendant. Cuvette signed and numbered, case numbered. Diam. 49 mm.
